title: Classes and Objects in Python

explanation.short: Classes are blueprints for creating objects. Use 'class' keyword and '__init__' method for initialization.
explanation.detailed: Python classes define object blueprints with attributes (data) and methods (functions). The __init__ method is the constructor, called when creating objects. 'self' refers to the instance. Python supports inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism. All methods take 'self' as first parameter.

key_points: Methods must have 'self' as first parameter
code_example:
# Basic class
class Person:
    def __init__(self, name, age):
        self.name = name
        self.age = age
    
    def greet(self):
        return f'Hi, I am {self.name}'
    
    def is_adult(self):
        return self.age >= 18

# Creating objects
person1 = Person('Alice', 25)
person2 = Person('Bob', 17)

print(person1.greet())  # Hi, I am Alice
print(person1.is_adult())  # True
print(person2.is_adult())  # False

# Inheritance
class Student(Person):
    def __init__(self, name, age, grade):
        super().__init__(name, age)
        self.grade = grade
    
    def study(self):
        return f'{self.name} is studying'

student = Student('Charlie', 20, 'A')
print(student.greet())  # Inherited from Person
print(student.study())  # Student's own method

# Class attributes (shared by all instances)
class Dog:
    species = 'Canis familiaris'  # Class attribute
    
    def __init__(self, name, breed):
        self.name = name  # Instance attribute
        self.breed = breed

dog1 = Dog('Buddy', 'Golden Retriever')
dog2 = Dog('Max', 'Beagle')
print(Dog.species)  # Canis familiaris
print(dog1.species)  # Canis familiaris (same for all)

key_concepts.purpose: Methods that work with class itself
Methods that don't use instance or class

best_practices: Use PascalCase for class names: MyClass not my_class
Use snake_case for method names: get_value not getValue
Keep classes focused on single responsibility
Use __init__ for initialization, not for heavy computation

common_mistakes.explanation: All instance methods must have 'self' as first parameter
Must call parent __init__ to initialize parent attributes
Must use self.attribute to access instance attributes
